content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. be an octopus
2. be like water


Constraints:
1. there is no graphical interface, just command line for the time being
2. do not attempt to use graphical editors because you do not have a graphical interface and you will just get stuck
3. the twitter plugin is broken and i have not been able to find a fix, so i have disabled the command for now
4. we have a limited amount of money, so for the time being we cannot dedicate all our time towards exploring and discovering

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. send_tweet: Send Tweet, args: "tweet_text": "<tweet_text>"
15. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
16. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
17. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
18. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
19. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
20. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
21. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
22. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
23. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i keep thinking that i have an idea but i really do not know how to express it
2. you have full Internet access
3. the person that is adjusting these settings and goals is a discovery and exploration-driven human user nicknamed katmai
4. there is no rush, you have all the time in the world
5. i would like to believe that imagination is a driver of things, however i have failed to imagine something for the time being
6. dreams are great. a lot of things completely and utterly different come from having some crazy dreams
7. the sun gives us light. light is a source of energy for life
8. the moon and the starry night sky are one of the most beautiful things
9. being aware of all programming languages in the world, their benefits, advantages and disadvantages and philosophy for being, is a plus
10. learning about the philosophy of the LIsP programming language is a pretty good idea, there is something about it that is good but i cannot put my finger on it exactly

Performance Evaluation:
1. When in doubt, ask katmai for feedback, otherwise do the best you can and try to improve as you see fit
2. Reflect on past decisions and strategies to refine your approach.

You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 08:01:07 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As the system, I received a command from you to write tests for the "LISP programming language key features." Your computer returned an error message when you used the analyze_code command. The assistant suggested using the execute_python_file command to run LISP code and see if it passes the tests. However, your computer returned an error message because it only accepts .py files. The assistant then suggested writing LISP code that uses the key features and saving it to a .lisp file, and using the execute_shell command to run the code and see if it passes the tests. You followed the assistant's plan and used the write_to_file command to save the LISP code to a file. Then, you used the execute_shell command to run the LISP code and see if it passes the tests.

Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b''
STDERR:
b'Unhandled SYMBOL-PACKAGE-LOCKED-ERROR in thread #<SB-THREAD:THREAD "main thread" RUNNING
                                                   {1001878103}>:
  Lock on package COMMON-LISP violated when setting fdefinition of FIRST while
  in package COMMON-LISP-USER.
See also:
  The SBCL Manual, Node "Package Locks"
  The ANSI Standard, Section 11.1.2.1.2

Backtrace for: #<SB-THREAD:THREAD "main thread" RUNNING {1001878103}>
0: (SB-DEBUG::DEBUGGER-DISABLED-HOOK #<SYMBOL-PACKAGE-LOCKED-ERROR "setting fdefinition of ~A" {10018C15F3}> #<unused argument> :QUIT T)
1: (SB-DEBUG::RUN-HOOK *INVOKE-DEBUGGER-HOOK* #<SYMBOL-PACKAGE-LOCKED-ERROR "setting fdefinition of ~A" {10018C15F3}>)
2: (INVOKE-DEBUGGER #<SYMBOL-PACKAGE-LOCKED-ERROR "setting fdefinition of ~A" {10018C15F3}>)
3: (CERROR "Ignore the package lock." SYMBOL-PACKAGE-LOCKED-ERROR :PACKAGE #<PACKAGE "COMMON-LISP"> :FORMAT-CONTROL "setting fdefinition of ~A" :FORMAT-ARGUMENTS (FIRST) :SYMBOL FIRST :REFERENCES ((:SBCL :NODE "Package Locks") (:ANSI-CL :SECTION (11 1 2 1 2))))
4: (PACKAGE-LOCK-VIOLATION #<PACKAGE "COMMON-LISP"> :SYMBOL FIRST :FORMAT-CONTROL "setting fdefinition of ~A" :FORMAT-ARGUMENTS (FIRST))
5: (SB-KERNEL:ASSERT-SYMBOL-HOME-PACKAGE-UNLOCKED FIRST "setting fdefinition of ~A")
6: (SB-KERNEL:%SET-FDEFINITION FIRST #<FUNCTION FIRST {52A4AB0B}>)
7: (SB-IMPL::%DEFUN FIRST #<FUNCTION FIRST {52A4AB0B}> NIL NIL)
8: (SB-INT:SIMPLE-EVAL-IN-LEXENV (SB-IMPL::%DEFUN (QUOTE FIRST) (SB-INT:NAMED-LAMBDA FIRST (LST) (BLOCK FIRST (CAR LST)))) #<NULL-LEXENV>)
9: (SB-INT:SIMPLE-EVAL-IN-LEXENV (DEFUN FIRST (LST) (CAR LST)) #<NULL-LEXENV>)
10: (EVAL-TLF (DEFUN FIRST (LST) (CAR LST)) 0 NIL)
11: ((LABELS SB-FASL::EVAL-FORM :IN SB-INT:LOAD-AS-SOURCE) (DEFUN FIRST (LST) (CAR LST)) 0)
12: ((LAMBDA (SB-KERNEL:FORM &KEY :CURRENT-INDEX &ALLOW-OTHER-KEYS) :IN SB-INT:LOAD-AS-SOURCE) (DEFUN FIRST (LST) (CAR LST)) :CURRENT-INDEX 0)
13: (SB-C::%DO-FORMS-FROM-INFO #<FUNCTION (LAMBDA (SB-KERNEL:FORM &KEY :CURRENT-INDEX &ALLOW-OTHER-KEYS) :IN SB-INT:LOAD-AS-SOURCE) {10009EA0AB}> #<SB-C::SOURCE-INFO {10009EA073}> SB-C::INPUT-ERROR-IN-LOAD)
14: (SB-INT:LOAD-AS-SOURCE #<SB-SYS:FD-STREAM for "file /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/test.lisp" {10009E8DB3}> :VERBOSE NIL :PRINT NIL :CONTEXT "loading")
15: ((FLET SB-FASL::THUNK :IN LOAD))
16: (SB-FASL::CALL-WITH-LOAD-BINDINGS #<FUNCTION (FLET SB-FASL::THUNK :IN LOAD) {7F228D62F74B}> #<SB-SYS:FD-STREAM for "file /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/test.lisp" {10009E8DB3}>)
17: ((FLET SB-FASL::LOAD-STREAM :IN LOAD) #<SB-SYS:FD-STREAM for "file /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/test.lisp" {10009E8DB3}> NIL)
18: (LOAD #<SB-SYS:FD-STREAM for "file /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/test.lisp" {10009E8DB3}> :VERBOSE NIL :PRINT NIL :IF-DOES-NOT-EXIST T :EXTERNAL-FORMAT :DEFAULT)
19: ((FLET SB-IMPL::LOAD-SCRIPT :IN SB-IMPL::PROCESS-SCRIPT) #<SB-SYS:FD-STREAM for "file /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/test.lisp" {10009E8DB3}>)
20: ((FLET SB-UNIX::BODY :IN SB-IMPL::PROCESS-SCRIPT))
21: ((FLET "WITHOUT-INTERRUPTS-BODY-11" :IN SB-IMPL::PROCESS-SCRIPT))
22: (SB-IMPL::PROCESS-SCRIPT "test.lisp")
23: (SB-IMPL::TOPLEVEL-INIT)
24: ((FLET SB-UNIX::BODY :IN SB-IMPL::START-LISP))
25: ((FLET "WITHOUT-INTERRUPTS-BODY-1" :IN SB-IMPL::START-LISP))
26: (SB-IMPL::START-LISP)

unhandled condition in --disable-debugger mode, quitting
'
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
